q: What is the name of the magical creature that can only be seen by those who have witnessed death?
What is Voldemort’s mother’s name?
What is Harry’s middle name?
What is the name of the popular wizarding newspaper based in London, England?
What kind of wood is Harry’s first wand made out of?
Who wrote A History of Magic?
What are employees of the Department of Mysteries called?
What magical creature is known for guarding Gringott’s Bank?
a: Ukrainian Ironbelly, a type of dragon

q: What is Hermione’s cat’s name?
What does Harry name his children?
a: James Sirius, Albus Severus and Lily Luna

q: Where does Rubeus Hagrid first tell Harry that he’s a wizard?
a: In a hut on a rock

q: What does Harry do to impress Professor McGonagall enough that she gets him on the Gryffindor Quidditch team?
Which puzzle guarding the Sorcerer’s Stone does Hermione Granger solve?
a: Professor Snape’s logic puzzle with potion bottles

q: Which mischievous character from the books did not feature in the movies?
The Hogwarts motto is “Draco dormiens nunquan titillandus.” What does it mean?
Who played Professor Dumbledore in the first movie?
What is the title of this book and movie everywhere except in the United States?
a: Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone

q: Who discovered the 12 uses for dragon blood?
In what year was the book Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone released in the United States?
How many presents did Dudley Dursley receive on his birthday in total?
a: 38. It was 36 (one less than last year), but then Mrs. Dursley bought him two new presents to make up for it.

q: What was the Fat Lady’s password to get into the Gryffindor common room?
What is the first line of the book?
a: Mr. and Mrs. Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much.

q: Where does Harry Potter first see Draco Malfoy?
a: In Madame Malkin’s Robes for All Occasions

q: What do Uncle Vernon and Aunt Petunia give Harry for Christmas?
This real-life library served as the restricted section of the Hogwarts library in the film version. Which is it?
a: The Bodleian Library at Oxford University

q: In the movie, Professor McGonagall explains the origins of the Chamber of Secrets. Who does it in the book?
a: Professor Binns, the history teacher (who is also a ghost)

q: Why does Neville Longbottom faint in Herbology class?
a: His earmuffs were loose, so he heard the cry of the baby mandrake.

q: On what date do the Weasleys rescue Harry from number four, Privet Drive?
Who removes all the bones from Harry’s arm?
When Harry, Ron and Hermione make Polyjuice Potion, who steals the ingredients from Professor Snape’s office?
When Hermione Granger is found Petrified, she is not alone. Who is with her?
What office does Arthur Weasley work for in the Ministry of Magic?
a: The Misuse of Muggle Artefacts Office

q: How many Muggles see the flying Ford Anglia as Harry and Ron make their way to school?
What is Gilderoy Lockhart’s favorite color?
What is the cure for being Petrified?
Who was headmaster or headmistress at Hogwarts when Tom Riddle was a student?
What is Gilderoy Lockhart’s autobiography called?
Where did Harry begin hearing the voice that no one else could hear?
Who is Stan Shunpike?
a: The conductor of the Knight Bus

q: Who plays Professor Dumbledore in this and the subsequent Harry Potter movies?
How many classes did Hermione Granger take this year?
During the Quidditch game between Gryffindor and Hufflepuff, who is the Hufflepuff seeker?
a: Cedric Diggory (unnamed in the movie, but not in the book)

q: In the book, who becomes the temporary guard to the Gryffindor common room after the Fat Lady’s painting is damaged?
Who did Harry overhear in the Three Broomsticks talking about how Sirius Black betrayed his parents?
a: Professor Flitwick, Professor McGonagall, Hagrid, Cornelius Fudge and Madam Rosmerta

q: Why do Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger stop speaking?
a: Ron blames Hermione’s cat, Crookshanks, for the disappearance of his pet rat, Scabbers.

q: What does Uncle Vernon’s sister, Marge Dursley, do for a living?
In the movie, what sound does Ron make after eating a magical candy?
What is Parvati Patil’s Boggart in the book and the movie?
a: In the book, a mummy; in the movie, a giant cobra

q: And how does Parvati defeat it?
a: In the book, the mummy trips on its wrappings. In the movie, it turns into a giant jack-in-the-box (arguably no less scary).

q: At the beginning of the story, where does Hedwig find Harry?
a: She is waiting in his room at the Leaky Cauldron. Clever owl!

q: When Neville Longbottom dresses his Boggart (Professor Snape) up in his grandmother’s clothes, what stuffed bird is on top of the hat?
When Professor Snape takes over Professor Lupin’s Defense Against the Dark Arts class, which page does he ask the students to turn to?
What two creatures are Hippogriffs a mix of?
How much gold do the Weasleys win in the Daily Prophet Grand Prize Galleon Draw?
And where do the Weasleys go on holiday with their winnings?
What is Fleur Delacour’s little sister’s name?
Who can turn into a beetle at will?
What two countries are competing in the Quidditch World Cup Final?
What beloved Hogwarts activity is canceled in the fourth year due to the Triwizard Tournament?
Who grows a beard after trying to cheat their way into the Triwizard Tournament?
Which important characters feature in the book but not the movie?
Members of which two famous U.K. bands played the band Weird Sisters at the Yule Ball?
How does Cedric Diggory defeat his dragon in the first task of the Triwizard Tournament?
a: He transfigures a rock into a dog to distract it.

q: What is Mad-Eye Moody’s catchphrase?
Which challenge in the Triwizard Tournament maze was left out of the movies?
In the book, the Weasleys come to pick up Harry for the Quidditch World Cup. Which of Fred and George’s candies does Dudley eat?
What does Mad-Eye Moody turn Draco Malfoy into?
What Quidditch team did Lugo Bagman play for?
And what position did Lugo play?
What is Ron Weasley’s role in S.P.E.W.?
Which exciting moment in the book is cut out of the movie?
What is the crime Harry commits that causes the Ministry of Magic to hold a disciplinary hearing for him?
a: He uses the Patronus Charm in front of a Muggle (Dudley, and only because there were Dementors!).

q: Which two students came up with the name “Dumbledore’s Army?”
Which of Harry’s acquaintances reveals that he doesn’t believe Harry’s story about Voldemort being back?
What is Draco Malfoy’s mother’s name?
What animal is Dolores Umbridge obsessed with?
In the book, what sport has Dudley recently taken up?
What is Hagrid’s half-brother’s name?
How does Dumbledore escape from his office when the Ministry of Magic comes to take him to Azkaban?
a: He grabs Fawkes’s tail, and they disappear in a flash of fire.

q: Where do Harry Potter and Cho Chang have their first kiss?
What is the address of the Headquarters of the Order of the Phoenix?
What did Sirius Black’s mother do to his name on the Black family tapestry?
What do Harry, Ron and Hermione find in the locked cabinet of a writing desk at the Order of the Phoenix Headquarters?
Hermione places a jinx on the piece of parchment members of Dumbledore’s Army sign. What happens to those who betray the group?
a: Pustules will form the word sneak across their foreheads.

q: In the book, which old friend do Harry, Ron and Hermione run into at St. Mungo’s Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries?
Who concocts a love potion meant for Harry that Ron ends up taking by mistake?
And who is Ron’s actual love interest this year?
Which of Voldemort’s Horcruxes do Harry and Dumbledore track down—but it turns out to be a fake?
What is the name of Fred and George Weasley’s shop?
Who teaches Potions class this year?
What are the gemstones in the cursed necklace Draco Malfoy buys from Borgin and Burkes?
What spell did Snape invent that Harry later uses on Draco Malfoy?
What does Hermione smell in the amortenia (or love) potion?
a: Grass, parchment, spearmint toothpaste and Ron Weasley’s hair

q: True or false: This is the longest movie in the franchise.
a: False! Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is the longest movie, at 161 minutes.

q: Lily Potter once gave Professor Slughorn a bowl with a lily that turned into a goldfish. What was the goldfish’s name?
How many Horcruxes have been destroyed at the end of this story?
a: Two: the diary and the ring

q: Who is the Half-Blood Prince?
What do all the hands on the Weasleys’s magical clock point to when Harry gets to the Burrow?
Who is in the first memory Professor Dumbledore shows Harry in the Pensieve?
a: Bob Ogden, an employee of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement

q: What are the three D’s of a successful Apparition?
Who loses an ear at the start of the book?
Which four characters hold the position of Minister of Magic throughout the books?
a: Cornelius Fudge, Rufus Scrimgeour, Pius Thicknesse and Kingsley Shacklebolt

q: In the epilogue to the book, who says, “Don’t let it worry you. It’s me, I’m extremely famous.”
In the movie, who hugs Draco Malfoy?
True or false: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part Two is the shortest Harry Potter movie.
a: True! The run time is just 130 minutes.

q: Which character do we see ride a broom for the first time in this movie?
On what date did the Battle of Hogwarts end with Voldemort’s death?
What is the name of Fleur Delacour and Bill Weasley’s house?
What fake illness does Ron Weasley say he has to cover up his absence from Hogwarts?
What does Harry steal from Dolores Umbridge’s office in the Ministry of Magic?
What is Luna Lovegood’s father’s name?
Who was in love with Helena Ravenclaw?
In the book, where do Hermione Granger’s parents move to?
What is Professor Snape’s Patronus?
a: A doe (the same as Lily Potter’s—sob)

q: What is the last line of the last book?
